result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray Anthony Robinson

records.addlTxt: 1:27 PM Defendant Ray Anthony Robinson appeared in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger. Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of not guilty entered subject to jurisdictional objections. Atty. Wenninger motion for bail modification. State opposes. Court denies motion for bail modification. Atty. Wenninger needs additional time to review discovery, requests 1/17/2023 status remain on the calendar.
for Bail Modification and Bond Condition Clarification, filed by Atty Wenninger - doc for review to clerk DK

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Ray Anthony Robinson appeared in person in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger.  Attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for State of Wisconsin. Det. J. Gehm sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Stumbris, crossexam by Atty. Wenninger, redirect. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Atty. Wenninger requests another date for Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Judge Cain sitting for Judge Malloy-10:11 AM Defendant Ray Anthony Robinson appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail. Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause. Defendant is on a probation hold. Defendant notified to contact the public defender. State recommends $10,000 cash bail w/conditions.
